com.appglu.android.sync
Class SyncDatabaseHelper

java.lang.Object
  android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      com.appglu.android.sync.SyncDatabaseHelper

public abstract class SyncDatabaseHelper
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper

SyncDatabaseHelper extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper to provide custom functionality: it creates meta-data tables required to perform a Sync operation with the AppGlu server.

Before having access to a SyncApi instance you will need to extend this class. By extending this class two methods will require overriding: onCreateAppDatabase(SQLiteDatabase) and onUpgradeAppDatabase(SQLiteDatabase, int, int).

Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
onCreateAppDatabase(SQLiteDatabase), onUpgradeAppDatabase(SQLiteDatabase, int, int), SyncApi

onCreateAppDatabase

public abstract void onCreateAppDatabase(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)

This method is similar to android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper#onCreate(SQLiteDatabase):
Called when the database is created for the first time. This is where the creation of tables and the initial population of the tables should happen.

Parameters:
db - The database

onUpgradeAppDatabase

public abstract void onUpgradeAppDatabase(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                                          int oldVersion,
                                          int newVersion)

This method is similar to android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper#onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase, int, int):
Called when the database needs to be upgraded. The implementation should use this method to drop tables, add tables, or do anything else it needs to upgrade to the new schema version.

Parameters:
db - The database
oldVersion - The old database version
newVersion - The new database version
